questions.question: Can you walk me through your design process — from understanding the problem to delivering the final UI?
questions.canonical_answer: I research the problem, define user needs, create flows and wireframes, prototype, test with users, iterate, and deliver polished UI designs.

questions.question: How do you balance aesthetics with usability in your designs?
questions.canonical_answer: I prioritize clarity, follow UX principles, use strong hierarchy, and ensure visuals enhance—not distract from—functionality.

questions.question: Which design tools do you use most often, and why do you prefer them?
questions.canonical_answer: I use Figma, Sketch, and Adobe XD for their collaboration features, easy prototyping, and efficient design workflows.

questions.question: Can you describe a time when you had to design for multiple screen sizes or platforms? How did you handle responsiveness and consistency?
questions.canonical_answer: I used responsive grids, scalable components, platform-specific guidelines, and tested across breakpoints to ensure consistency.

questions.question: How do you collaborate with developers and UX designers during a project?
questions.canonical_answer: I communicate early, share prototypes, clarify interactions, gather feedback, and support implementation through handoff tools.

questions.question: Tell me about a time when you received critical feedback on your design. How did you handle it?
questions.canonical_answer: I listened openly, evaluated the feedback using user needs and data, iterated the design, and improved the final outcome.

questions.question: What usability heuristics would you check during a heuristic evaluation?
questions.canonical_answer: I check visibility of system status, consistency, error prevention, flexibility, learnability, and recognition over recall.
